name: AHMED ADEL ABDELRADY AHMED
intro_html: I’m an optimistic, ambitious Mechatronics Engineer with a strong foundation in mechanical and electrical principles, complemented by competence in computer science, pneumatic systems, and robotics. I’m especially focused on how AI can elevate mechatronic systems—from data‑driven modelling and intelligent control to embedded machine learning and automation. My goal is to build reliable, safe, and human‑centred systems where rigorous engineering meets modern AI.

projects.title: AI‑Assisted Upper‑Limb Prosthetic
projects.desc: Surface EMG gesture control with servo actuation and sensory feedback pipeline.

projects.title: Parkinson’s Monitoring IoT
projects.desc: ESP32‑based wearable features streaming to dashboard; experimentation with edge AI.

projects.title: Boe‑Bot Line/Obstacle Robot
projects.desc: IR line following with ultrasonic obstacle avoidance; simple PID tuning.

strengths: PO4–PO12 = 1.0: Investigation, design, communication, sustainability, professional practice, ethics, teamwork/lead, lifelong learning, and project management are all consistently demonstrated.
PO3 = 0.89: Confident with tools/tech (ROS2, SolidWorks, MATLAB, embedded/IoT).
PO2 = 0.86: Strong problem analysis and decomposition.
weaknesses: PO1 = 0.50: Core maths/science theory needs deeper practice and clearer use in reports.
Evidence mapping: Artefacts can link more explicitly to each PO with metrics/screenshots.
opportunities: Lift PO1: Weekly problem sets + add derivations/models to project docs.
Close PO2/PO3 gap: Add small benchmarks/A–B tests and uncertainty/error analyses.
Stronger PO evidence: Add risk, ethics and sustainability checklists to each repo.
threats: Over‑reliance on tools instead of theory slows PO1–PO3 growth.
Hardware delays or scope creep reduce time for PO1 practice.
